page.title: 06Everton Park
page.content:
To make way for the proposed large park, a number of high-rise flats and maisonettes are to be demolished.
Most residents have already been rehoused in alternative areas but those who still live or work here are of one mind, {opposing }the project. { { Rev. J. Charley,}whose church lies within the park boundaries, is helping people who find the prospect of rehousing daunting. He has also helped other residents to form action groups to try to find a solution so that the {community spirit}which{has grown}since the slum clearance of the 1960's is retained wherever they are rehoused.
No matter who one asks, the overall picture is one of{ anger} that such a close knit community can be destroyed.
